data.question: What is the targeted metal-organic framework discussed by O. M. Yaghi and co-workers?
What synthesis strategy was necessary for MOF-500 due to the insolubility of IRMOP-51?
Is MOF-500 synthesized using a step-by-step addition of components?
What are the building blocks of MOF-500?
What is the role of BPDC in the synthesis of MOF-500?
data.answer: It acts as a multitopic organic linker

data.question: Does MOF-500 have a hierarchical system of pores?
What is the crystal structure similarity between MOF-500 and its molecular building blocks?
data.answer: The structure of the extended network MOF-500 and that of its molecular building blocks (IRMOP-51) have remarkable similarities

data.question: What increases on going from IRMOP-51 to MOF-500?
Is the step-by-step assembly of MOF-500 feasible in practice?
What is the role of BPE in the synthesis of MOF-500?
data.answer: BPE acts as a linker to replace pyridine ligands, creating interconnected pores for gas storage

data.question: What was the yield of MOF-500 based on H2BPDC?
Does MOF-500 have a higher sorption capacity than IRMOP-51?
What is the symmetry of MOF-500 and cubic IRMOP-51?
What is the effect of linking IRMOP-51 into a rigid framework?
data.answer: It results in a fourfold increase in argon sorption capacity

data.question: Is the structure of MOF-500 built up from four levels of hierarchy?
What are the types of pores identified in MOF-500?
What is the significance of the pore size distribution in MOF-500?
data.answer: It confirms the presence of multiple types of pores, characteristic known from the crystal structure

data.question: Can the structure of MOF-500 be described as a binary sphalerite (ZnS) net?
What is the role of TEA in the synthesis of MOF-500?
data.answer: TEA is used in the reaction conditions to synthesize MOF-500

data.question: Does the synthesis of MOF-500 involve the use of Fe2(SO4)3?
